link.script: function toggleMe(a){ var e=document.getElementById(a); var i = document.getElementById(a + '_image'); if(!e)return true; if(e.style.display=="none"){ e.style.display="block" i.src = 'YOUR OPEN IMAGE URL'; } else { e.style.display="none" i.src = 'YOUR CLOSED IMAGE URL'; } return false; }

div.a: Empty

div.h3: Welcome to Port Angeles School District

p.br:
All Port Angeles School District students will graduate prepared for life-long learning
Mission
The Port Angeles School District creates learning communities that prepare each student to live, work, and learn successfully in a changing world.
Beliefs
Every student can learn. Every person has worth. School safety matters.
Inclement Weather
Visit Inclement Weather to learn more about how to prepare for inclement weather.

div.p: All students who qualified for free/reduced price lunches last school year must reapply again this year. Please visit the link below to read more and download a copy of the Free and Reduced Meal application.

p.a: Port Angeles School District Food Services, Free and Reduced Meals Information

div.p: If you have additional questions, please call 360.565.3751.

img.alt: Free Sack Lunch and Breakfast Available for Students
img.title: Free Sack Lunch and Breakfast Available for Students

a.title: Free Sack Lunch and Breakfast Available for Students

div.a: Free Sack Lunch and Breakfast Available for Students
div.div: Sack lunch and breakfasts will be available to children ages 2-18 free of charge. The child must be present to receive the meals.
div.a: Read More about Free Sack Lunch and Breakfast Available for Students

img.alt: Schools remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year
img.title: Schools remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year

a.title: Schools remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year

div.a: Schools remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year
div.div: Port Angeles, WA - Governor Inslee announced yesterday that all schools will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year in order to slow the spread of COVID-19.
div.a: Read More about Schools remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year

img.alt: Spring Break Still Scheduled for April 6 - 10
img.title: Spring Break Still Scheduled for April 6 - 10

a.title: Spring Break Still Scheduled for April 6 - 10

div.a: Spring Break Still Scheduled for April 6 - 10
div.div: Spring Break for Port Angeles School District is next week, Monday, April 6 through Friday, April 10. Previously, we asked students and families to treat the week of March 16th as their Spring Break.
div.a: Read More about Spring Break Still Scheduled for April 6 - 10
March 24th PASD Update
div.div: Dear PASD families, As we begin our second full week of closure, we can’t help but appreciate the love, support, and generosity of this incredible community that we live in. Each day, we hear and see amazing examples of kindness and goodwill.
div.a: Read More about March 24th PASD Update
Student Belongings and Meals
div.div: Students will be able to pick up their personal belongings Wednesday through Friday this week. Pick up will be from 10am to 1pm.
div.a: Read More about Student Belongings and Meals
PASD Social Distancing Support
div.div: we apologize for the late notice last night regarding closing school today. There were several circumstances that changed the decision. Mainly, it was learning of Governor Inslee’s intent to impose additional restrictions across our state. To protect our staff, students, and community, we closed schools. We are working on establishing days/times for students to pick-up personal belongings. More details to come on that matter.
div.a: Read More about PASD Social Distancing Support
March 16th School Closure
div.div: UPDATE - March 15, 2020 - Because of Governor Inslee’s announcement this evening regarding his intent to add additional state-wide restrictions, the Port Angeles School District is closing all schools to students and most staff starting tomorrow, Monday March 16th. Once again, there will be no school starting tomorrow. Further information as to when parents and students can come to school to pick up personal items will be announced tomorrow.
div.a: Read More about March 16th School Closure

p.span:
905 West Ninth St.
Port Angeles, WA 98363
Phone: 360-457-8575
Fax: 360-457-0795

div.div: Port Angeles School District | 905 W. 9th Street, Port Angeles, WA 98363 | Phone 360-457-8575 | Fax 360-457-0795

p.strong: Port Angeles School District is an Equal Opportunity Employer

span.p: Port Angeles School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Title IX Coordinators, Civil Rights Compliance Coordinators: Scott Harker, 905 W. 9th Street Port Angeles, WA 98363, (360) 457-8575, sharker@portangelesschools.org, for Section 504/ADA Coordinator, Pamela Sanford, 905 W. 9th Street Port Angeles, WA 98363, (360) 457-8575, psanford@portangelesschools.org.
Please visit our page on Complaint Procedures for more information.

For questions or concerns regarding the PASD website or subsidiary pages please contact Webmaster.
